Title: OxyPlot (moved to GitHub)
Description: OxyPlot is a cross-platform plotting library for .NET.
HomeWiki:
This project has moved to GitHub

http://github.com/oxyplot











































































Project Description
OxyPlot is a cross-platform plotting library for .NET.
  • For examples, see the Silverlight Example Browser
  • The documentation is located at oxyplot.org (under construction, please contribute)
  • NuGet packages are updated at every code check-in
  • Please fork and contribute!


Status

Platform Status
WPF Stable
Windows forms Stable
Windows 8 Stable
Windows phone 8 Alpha
Windows universal Planned
Silverlight Stable
GTK# Alpha
Xamarin.iOS Stable
Xamarin.Android Stable
Xamarin.Mac Planned

News

  • Rename `Plot` control to `PlotView`(May 16, 2014)
  • Xamarin packages on NuGet (May 14, 2014)
  • Windows Phone support - alpha (May 13, 2014)
  • New build server running Windows 8.1 and VS 2013(January 18, 2014)
  • Changed style and added documentation to oxyplot.org page (January 18, 2014)
  • Added PDF export to the core library (November 12, 2013)
  • Registered the oxyplot.org domain (July 4, 2013)
  • OxyPlot listed as a cool library on Scott Hanselman's presentation on Xamarin Evolve (slide 87)!
  • Changed the OxyPlot core to a Portable Class Library (PCL). The same assembly can be used on WPF, Windows Forms, Windows Store apps and Silverlight (January 31, 2013)
  • Added HeatMapSeries (January 31, 2012)
  • Added support for images (January 31, 2012)
  • The example browser for Windows 8 is certified in the Windows store (November 12, 2012)
  • Changed to MIT license (GPL compatible) (October 20, 2012)
  • Added Metro NuGet package (September 6, 2012)
  • Build server moved to a virtual machine (Windows 8, VS 2012) (September 6, 2012)
  • Metro example applications (August 31, 2012)
  • Mono for Android implementation, (May 11, 2012)
  • New BoxPlotSeries (April 12, 2012)
  • MonoTouch implementation, submitted by dvkwong (March 12, 2012)
  • Changed to Mercurial (March 3, 2012)
  • The project is built at CodeBetter (Dec 12, 2011)
  • Continuous integration with TeamCity. Runs NUnit, dotCover, DuplicatesFinder and has automatic push of Nuget packages (Nov 13, 2011)
  • NuGet packages: Wpf / Silverlight (March 9, 2011)
  • Example Browser (available for both WPF, Silverlight and WinForms. All sharing the same examples) (March 19, 2011)

Project roadmap

  • Create Xamarin component
  • Support for MonoMac / Xamarin.Mac

IDE compatibility

  • Visual Studio 2010 with Portable Library Tools
  • Visual Studio 2012 with Update 3 or later
